definition: to suffer/to endure/to pull through (hard times)/to delay/to stall/to play for time/to dawdle

sentences.english: And they preferred hunger and famine to the desecration of the ancestral grave…
sentences.chinese: 他们宁可自己忍饥挨饿也不愿亵渎祖先们的坟茔。

sentences.english: My childhood was not one of hunger and cold .
sentences.chinese: 我的童年既不挨饿也不受冻。

sentences.english: The workers were frequently beaten and were forced to live in prison-like conditions.
sentences.chinese: 工人们经常挨打挨饿，被迫在监牢般的环境中生活。

sentences.english: Millions of people starved to death during the war.
sentences.chinese: 战争中数百万计的人挨饿至死。

sentences.english: He had accompanied a convoy of emergency food supplies to the starving people of Pader.
sentences.chinese: 当时他陪同运粮车队到帕德救济挨饿的百姓。

sentences.english: Is it really that you are going to end up on the street starving or become unemployable?
sentences.chinese: 你难道真的会落到在街头挨饿或一直失业吗？

sentences.english: A dime sometimes meant the difference between eating and starving.
sentences.chinese: 有时候一角钱意味着吃饱还是挨饿。

sentences.english: So we use the wand to conjure up the book, pencils and erasers.
sentences.chinese: 超级兔看见了一群人在挨饿，立刻用魔棒变出了食物。

sentences.english: I think they must cancel the World Cup because people are starving.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他们应该取消世界杯，因为人们正在挨饿。

sentences.english: An acute lack of nutriment brought hunger to the Iraqi human.
sentences.chinese: 食品重大缺乏，伊拉克人民正在忍饥挨饿。

sentences.english: Pre-agricultural man confined to raw food would have starved.
sentences.chinese: 农业文明前的人类如果只吃未加工的食物就会挨饿。

sentences.english: Follin's justification for stealing was that his family were starving.
sentences.chinese: 福林为自己偷窃辩解的理由是他的家人正在挨饿。

sentences.english: Hunger was his daily portion while he was living with the Dursleys.
sentences.chinese: 住在德思礼家中里，挨饿是他注定要过的苦日子。

sentences.english: Many children in the orphanage were starved often.
sentences.chinese: 孤儿院中的孩子们常常挨饿。

sentences.english: Before liberation , he often went hungry .
There are still hungry people in the world .
sentences.chinese: 世界上还有忍饥挨饿的人。

definition: to starve to death/to be very hungry
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
beset by hunger and cold (idiom)/starving and freezing/in desperate poverty
to endure/to suffer/hardships/torments/a hard time/a nuisance
to be without food or clothing (idiom)/to be very poor
